snippet: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel left Afghanistan on Monday after a visit marked by violent attacks and criticisms of American and NATO policy from President Hamid Karzai.
abstract: News analysis; Chuck Hagel, in his first overseas trip as defense secretary, leaves Afghanistan, visit marked by violent attack and criticisms of American and NATO policy from Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai; avoids being drawn into public dispute with Karzai, maintaining his reserve throughout, in particular during public events surround his closed-door meetings with Karzai and security ministers.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel left Afghanistan on Monday after a visit marked by violent attacks and criticisms of American and NATO policy from President Hamid Karzai.

headline.main: In First Overseas Trip, Hagel Offers a Terse Review: ‘It’s Complicated’
headline.print_headline: In First Overseas Trip, Hagel Offers a Terse Review: ‘It’s Complicated’

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
